intro: Galium aladaghense, commonly known as the Aladagh bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Galium aladaghense is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
